009package imagingbook.common.filter.linear;
010
011import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilter;
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterScalarSeparable;
013import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
014
015/**
016 * This class represents a 2D linear filter that is x/y-separable and
017 * specified by two 1D-kernels.
018 * It is based on {@link GenericFilter} and {@link GenericFilterScalarSeparable},
019 * which take care of all data copying and filter mechanics.
020 * Since it is a "scalar" filter, pixel values are treated as scalars.
021 * If the processed image has more than one component 
022 * (e.g., a RGB color image), this filter is automatically 
023 * and independently applied to all (scalar-valued) components.
024 * To apply to an image, use the {@link #applyTo(ij.process.ImageProcessor)}
025 * method, for example.
026 */
027public class LinearFilterSeparable extends GenericFilterScalarSeparable {
028
029        private float[] hX = null;                      // the horizontal kernel array
030        private float[] hY = null;                      // the vertical kernel array
031        private int width = 0;                          // width of the effective kernel
032        private int height = 0;                         // height of the effective kernel
033        private int xc = 0;                                     // 'hot spot' x-position
034        private int yc = 0;                                     // 'hot spot' y-position
035        
036        /**
037         * Constructor, takes a 1D convolution kernel to be applied both
038         * in x- and y-direction. 
039         * 
040         * @param kernelXY a 1D convolution kernel
041         */
042        public LinearFilterSeparable(Kernel1D kernelXY) {
043                this(kernelXY, kernelXY);
044        }
045        
046        /**
047         * Constructor, takes two 1D convolution kernels to be applied
048         * in x- and y-direction, respectively.
049         * One (but not both) of the supplied kernels may be {@code null}.
050         * If this is the case, filtering in the associated direction
051         * is skipped.
052         * 
053         * @param kernelX a 1D kernel for convolution in x-direction
054         * @param kernelY a 1D kernel for convolution in y-direction
055         */
056        public LinearFilterSeparable(Kernel1D kernelX, Kernel1D kernelY) {
057                super();
058                
059                if (kernelX == null && kernelY == null) {
060                        throw new RuntimeException("both X/Y kernels may not be null");
061                }
062                
063                if (kernelX == null) {
064                        this.doX = false;       // skip X-part
065                }
066                else {
067                        this.hX = kernelX.getH();
068                        this.width = kernelX.getWidth();
069                        this.xc = kernelX.getXc();
070                }
071                
072                if (kernelY == null) {
073                        this.doY = false;       // skip Y-part
074                }
075                else {
076                        this.hY = kernelY.getH();
077                        this.height = kernelY.getWidth();
078                        this.yc = kernelY.getXc();
079                }
080        }
081
082        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
083
084        // 1D convolution in x-direction
085        @Override
086        protected float doPixelX(PixelSlice source, int u, final int v) {
087                double sum = 0;
088                for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
089                        int ui = u + i - xc;
090                        sum = sum + source.getVal(ui, v) * hX[i];
091                }
092                return (float)sum;
093        }
094        
095        // 1D convolution in y-direction
096        @Override
097        protected float doPixelY(PixelSlice source, final int u, int v) {
098                double sum = 0;
099                for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
100                        int vj = v + j - yc;
101                        sum = sum + source.getVal(u, vj) * hY[j];
102                }
103                return (float)sum;
104        }
105
106}
